Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Thomson Group Representation Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Thomson Group Representation Constituency** (GRC) was a defunct four-member [group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) that compromises of Bishan East, Serangoon Gardens, Bishan North and Thomson from 1991 to 1997. It merged parts of [Thomson](/wiki/Thomson,_Singapore) and [Serangoon Gardens](/wiki/Serangoon_Gardens) itself. Thomson GRC was led by Leong Horn Kee and [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng). ## History The ward only exist for one term until 1997. Bishan and Thomson, along with [Toa Payoh GRC](/wiki/Toa_Payoh_Group_Representation_Constituency), was merged to create [Bishan–Toa Payoh GRC](/wiki/Bishan%E2%80%93Toa_Payoh_Group_Representation_Constituency), while Serangoon Gardens was absorbed into three constituencies, namely [Aljunied GRC](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency), [Ang Mo Kio GRC](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_Group_Representation_Constituency) and [Marine Parade GRC](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Members of Parliament YearDivisionMembers of ParliamentParty**Formation**(/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election) - **Bishan East** - **Serangoon Gardens** - **Bishan North** - **Thomson** - [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) - Lau Teik Soon - Ibrahim Othman - Leong Horn Kee [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**Constituency abolished (1997)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates.
